fields.summary: Dragging an issue in plan mode does not cancel with escape

fields.description:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Specifying+your+GreenHopper+General+Configuration

Page mentions 'Issue Link Type' which is made available by the Links Hierarchy Reports plugin. 
- This plugin is for JIRA 4.1 - 4.4.5.
- The Greenhopper documentation is for 5.10.x, which is only compatible with JIRA 5.x and later.

We should probably remove the mention of the plugin on newer docs.
fields.summary: Greenhopper docs mention unsupported plugin
update nav instructions for GreenHopper Configuration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Parent issue without estimate is not showing sub-task's estimate in the rapid board plan mode.
Currently, it's difficult to have the real total estimates for a sprint or somehow will cause confusion for users to plan ahead for next sprint.


h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a Software Project.
# Create an issue.
# Create a sub-task from the issue, set *original estimate* to 3w.
# Observe the parent issue, the Time Tracking is showing 3w as original estimate and remaining if the option to include sub-tasks is selected.
#  !parentIssue.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a board for this project.
# Configure the board to estimate the issues in the Backlog using *Original Time Estimate* and *Track time against issues using JIRA's Remaining Estimate and Time Spent fields*
# Go back to the board, choose to *show detail view*
# Click on the parent issue


h3. Expected result

The original estimate should show the total estimate for both the parent and sub task.


h3. Actual result

The original estimate is showing _unestimated_.
 !unestimated.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Suggestion

Parent issue without estimate should include its sub-task's estimates in rapid board plan mode since the sub-tasks are not shown in the issue details.
fields.summary: Parent issue without estimate should provide its subtasks estimates in rapid board plan mode

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to be able to start a sprint with a start date specified in the past.

This was a problem for us because we neglected to start the sprint in GreenHopper when the sprint actually started, so I wanted to retrospectively start it. (This happened because we did the sprint planning and acceptance whilst the previous sprint was ongoing, and GreenHopper won't allow us to specify the next sprint without ending the current one. By the time the next sprint started, we forgot to start it in GreenHopper. (We're new to using GreenHopper in our scrum process :-) ) I believe multiple sprints is a feature that is being planned for a future GreenHopper release?)
fields.summary: Allow sprint start date in past

fields.description: Note - this feature will only be available to JIRA versions 5.0.4 and later. (We should still QA earlier versions of JIRA to ensure that this feature does not apply.)
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to modify the underlying workflow from a board, so that I can add columns to my board without using JIRA's administration UI

fields.description: Note - this feature will only be available to JIRA versions 5.0.4 and later. (We should still QA earlier versions of JIRA to ensure that this feature does not apply.)
fields.summary: As a user, I want a simplified workflow for my newly created project from GH, so that I can easily move between all workflow steps
Switch to work mode when Sprint is started

{noformat}
2012-07-14 10:12:40,655 http-8080-4 WARN admin 612x886x1 iprfqe 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/UpdateField.jspa [atlassian.greenhopper.service.I18nFactoryServiceImpl] null key passed to i18n.getText
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The key argument must not be null
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.I18nFactoryServiceImpl$I18nHelperWrapper.nullCheck(I18nFactoryServiceImpl.java:194)

fields.summary: Not able to edit an issue's version through Agile > Planning Board

fields.description:
Hello team,

We would like to request an improvement on Sprint Report, to allow it to show information of sub-tasks on a sprint. Currently only the information about parent issues is shown.

Please let us know if this is possible to implement.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Show sub-tasks information on Sprint Report

fields.description: it only scrolls to the issue such that its still stuck in the stalker/umbra. this happens with most transitions. see screenshot.
fields.summary: Transitioning an issue in IE8 does not scroll to the issue fully

fields.description:
Hello team,

We've discovered, after an user reported a performance issue, that some threads on GreenHopper aren't using a synchronized protection, which means that we can have data inconsistency or infinite loops caused by multiple threads accessing a share resource.

On a specific case, the customer was able to track that a thread of com.pyxis.greenhopper.GreenHopperImpl.put method was stuck. Also, as per his comments:

{quote}
Therefore, I conclude that the HashMap is being improperly accessed. I checked the code - and sure enough - if you track the stack backwards from the put() higher, I see no use of synchronization primitives. No thread safety. 18 threads are locked in a put() against a non-thread-safe data structure. Something is wrong.

The consequence of improper access are varied and random as they depend on the exact assumptions that each thread is making about cached data. One possible outcome can be a regular loop accessing the data structure turns into an infinite loop due to a "circular" reference, because of incorrect assumptions that the JVM is making about the data it is accessing.
{quote}

Could you please consider this and tell us if this is possible to implement a protection on running threads?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Implement use of synchronized threads on shared data structures

fields.description: Currently on some system default fields are shown. It would be nice to be able to display other fields.
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board User I would like to be able to display more fields in the issue view column

fields.description: Greenhopper Documentation at [Latest Versions of Downloadable Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ALLDOC/GreenHopper+Documentation+Directory#GreenHopperDocumentationDirectory-downloads] when exported to PDF shows header from GH 5.9.
fields.summary: Documentation for 5.10 needs review

fields.description:
Say for example 2 RB's are set up filtering:

RB1 = project = test AND labels = 1
RB2 = project = test AND labels = 2

But then 3 issues are created with labels
TST-1 label = 1
TST-2 label = 1 2
TST-3 label = 2

When RB1 has started a sprint with TST-1 and TST-2 there's no obvious way on RB2 that the issue TST-2 is stuck in the sprint disallowing a new sprint to be started, unless going to the work mode.

With more issues coming in then this problem becomes more difficult to solve in work mode.


Along with that please make it clear to the user why these sprints are locked up, Atlassian Support has noticed that this process here is not inherently understood in the product.
fields.summary: Allow users to see more clearly the overlapping cases in RB's locked into sprints in Plan Mode
Make the name of the rapid board on the Manage Rapid Boards page the link to use the board

fields.description:
*Current Scenario*
# RapidBoard enabled on GreenHopper
# All issues will have the buttons "Rapid Board" and "Rank to top" on the Issue View

*Problem*
It causes some confusion for users that don't know what it means. We had to disable the Rapid Board module for the whole instance due to the complains of users that didn't want the buttons on the Issue View.

*Desirable*
Being able to enable Rapid Board (or its buttons) just for some projects, the same way you can do for GreenHopper.
fields.summary: As an Administrator, I would like to be able to enable RapidBoard just for some projects

fields.description:
We currently only see parent tasks in Plan and we can see parent tasks and subtasks in Work. But when we are planning and/or closing a Sprint, we can't see anything regarding Subtasks. We need to be able to see Subtasks with Planning and Reporting...especially Reporting

Ex.
Parent Task -01
SubTask -02
SubTask -03
SubTask -04
...completed -02 and -03 during Sprint...once Sprint is closed...
Reports don't show anything - it looks as though nothing is completed, no work is done...

Need subtasks in rapidboards please...???

Dean
fields.summary: Scrum/Sprint Rapid Board - Ability to "Plan" and "Report" on sub-tasks

fields.description:
When the time unit is set to Days and all the work log in the sprint is in days. Estimation configured to Original Time Estimate. 

However, Greenhopper is not using the time unit of JIRA time tracking as the default measurement. The Original Time Estimate in burndown chart was shown in hours instead of days. In addition, the Original Time Estimate also showing hours in Sprint Report.
fields.summary: JIRA Software Burndown Chart and Sprint Report to be measured by Days
Changing version in the issue cards on the planning board in any viewing mode other than 'version' throws error

fields.description:
Alex's soke investigations revealed that the cost of computing the total list of boards for ANY board is very high.  We do this so we can show the board switcher select box even if the user never switches board.

We should move to a frother style to delay loading the list of boards

fields.description:
Drag & drop issues/cards in GreenHopper taskboard is broken (the process keeps spinning) with JIRA 5.1.

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as at July 10 2012| borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#ccc| titleBGColor=#49BD5F| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
We are actively working on this issue and expect to have a fix for the next release to OnDemand which is due to happen this weekend (i.e by Monday 16th of July)

*Workarounds*

Several workarounds are available. Pick the one that suits you best.

* Submit a [support request|https://support.atlassian.com] and and an engineer will upgrade GreenHopper on your OnDemand instance to a fixed version.
* Perform the transition 'manually' using the JIRA view.
* Use keyboard shortcuts as described in [the comments|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-5437?focusedCommentId=324765&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-324765].
{panel}
fields.summary: Task board drag & drop broken in JIRA 5.1

Also, if you add and then remove a parent from a sprint, subtasks appear as never having been added to the sprint, even though they were part of the sprint when the parent was.

An exception occurs. See screenshot.

Note that the dates are still editable. But the presence of the exception is not great.

fields.description:
If an issue has several changes to its story points field before starting a sprint, the chart and report are supposed to show the last changed-to value. Due to this bug this is not always the case.

Example:
SP field changed from 3 -> 6, then 6 -> 8, then 8 -> 3, then the Sprint is started. Naturally 3 SP should show up on both, the burndown and the report. Currently this isn't always the case, so 6 or 8 or even no value could be shown.

This bug applies to statistic value burndowns, but not to the hour burndown chart.
fields.summary: Rapid Board Burndown Chart and Sprint Report show older story point field value

fields.description: When a user drags an issue to the backlog (above the sprint marker) in the rapid board, the issues do not persist over sessions when the sprint hasn't started.
fields.summary: Keep items dragged into the backlog on the rapid board persistent through user sessions when sprint hasn't started

fields.description:
This [The Future of GreenHopper|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/The+Future+of+GreenHopper] page suggests that now is not a good time to start with Rapid Board if you're a scrum team. 

Now that we're [Announcing GreenHopper 5.10 – The Best Tool for Scrum Teams|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2012/06/announcing-greenhopper-5-10-the-best-tool-for-scrum-teams/], can we update this page to reflect that the Rapid Board is good-to-go?
fields.summary: Update the 'Future of GreenHopper' doc - ready for Scrum!

fields.description:
See the enclosed screenshot.
I would like to see the changed scope of a user story on the sprint report.
i.e: Now, the sprint report only shows the original estimates, and does not handle the scope creep as the burndown chart does.
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user, i want to be informed of the changed scope change in my Sprint Report

fields.description: - With 45 issues doing this manually is very painful (particularly when you're trying to reconcile history)
fields.summary: As support, I need an itemized list of the remaining time/items at the end of the Sprint in the burndown

Mark Lassau and Graeme Smith working on this

fields.description: Cannot scroll as well, so forced to use escape. Not a good user experience.
fields.summary: Create Board dialog cancel button hidden when window height is short

fields.description:
Rather than just having the individual swimlane expand / collapse function, it will be convenient to have the expand / collapse all the swimlanes in one go.

COS: 
- Menu items will appear at the bottom of the Tools menu
- Include a keyboard shortcut for toggling expand/collapse all 
- Decide on a keyboard shortcut (Current choice is {{MINUS SIGN}})
fields.summary: Expand / Collapse All Swimlanes on the Rapid Board

fields.description:
As a user I can do a JQL search for Custom Field "Sprint" name, rather than ID

Currently in JIRA 5.6 and GreenHopper 5.10.3  when doing a JQL search for a Rapid Board Sprint those are done by id numbers eg: *Sprint = 1* it would be best to have this as a per name basis eg: *Sprint = "sprint 2"* 
This would likely call for unique sprint names however.

Along with this as a user I would like to do historical JQL sprint searching eg: *Sprint was "sprint 2"
fields.summary: As a user I can do a JQL search for Custom Field "Sprint" name, rather than ID

fields.description:
Two related cases:

* After using st or sb, the next issue is selected for you. However, when you subsequently perform a shift-select to select an issue range the wrong starting point is used (it's the last issue which you selected with your mouse, not the one selected after using st/sb)

* Similarly, using j or k to traverse a column does not updated the last selected issue, which also breaks shift select.
fields.summary: Multi-select broken by keyboard shortcuts

fields.description: Our development teams are separated into pods. Each of these pods are working on a different release simultaneously. The limitation that you can only have one sprint active per project limits the use of rapid board for our teams.
fields.summary: Ability to have one sprint active per Agile board even if they are in the same project

fields.description: Scrum based sprints need to have planning and retrospection meeting. GH should provide ability to associate retrospection notes and possibly provide ability to track the issues to closure.
fields.summary: Need a feature to attach retrospective notes

fields.description: Need an ability to see all the sprints. A product company needs to have multiple sprints sometimes with different timeframes to meet deadline. Having ability to putup a calendar of Sprints and possible with some text message will be useful for executives to review Sprint plans and focus areas from planning perspective.
fields.summary: Need ability to view all the sprints

fields.description:
Adding issues to the current active sprint in greenhopper is a hassle.
We need to find in plan mode and rank it to the top and only than drag it to the current active sprint - it can be very frustrating.

Regarding the location of the buttun within the issue page we would like to have one of the foloowing:
1. An action button just like we have Workflow actions within the issue page
2. It can sit down next to the link "View in rapid board".

We would also like to see it in the plan mode as an action at the right hand panel (after clikcing the Options drop-down menu).
fields.summary: We would like to have the Action button "Add to active sprint" within the issue page and in Plan mode within Rapid Board

fields.description:
Currenlty GH seems to lack a way to see the total work estimate AGAINST the work time available in a sprint. I think this information would be handy to have in both Plan and Work modes. 

1) In the Plan mode, as I move the grey Sprint Maker up and down to determine the the amount of work to assign in the sprint I'm planning for, it would be useful to have the total amount of time available for the sprint shown somewhere on the screen, that way I can do the planning work more quickly and intuitively. Pretty much like what the Statistics bar lets us do in the Planning Board. 

2) Then in the Work mode, while each issue block has its original estimate shown, nowhere shown is the total amount of those estimate time nor the remaining time left within the current sprint. 

I know scrum resists midstream changes, but things do change for us anyway, so this will information facilitate us to respond quickly at least..
fields.summary: Making total estimate time and remaining Sprint time available in Rapid Board Scrum

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a chart to measure the average speed up to a certain date of a sprint.

Let's suppose there is a sprint of 5 days for a total of 150 story points. 
At the end of the third day the team has burned a total of 75 story points. To measure the average speed we would consider the following formula: 75burned story points/3days. For us the average of our team is 25 x story points per day

A gadget or a chart to represent this value in JIRA would be of great value.
fields.summary: Gadget/Chart to measure the average speed per sprint up to a certain date

fields.description: For teams using the rapid board in Greenhopper, but also a physical scrumboard it is essential to be able to print cards.
fields.summary: Ability to print cards from an agile board

fields.description: We have an increasing number of rapid boards in use by our organization and would like to be able to categorize them for quick sorting and selection. An equivalent feature exists for categorizing projects in JIRA.
fields.summary: As an Administrator, I would like to be able to categorize rapid boards in order to quickly locate one from a long list

fields.description: We use JIRA for a large open source project and have shared our product roadmap with the community via a rapid board with a shared filter. The community does not have the global right to share filters but they are copying the rapid board and cluttering our rapid board list as a result. It is also confusing our community because they do not know which one to pick.
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board owner, I would like to share boards with users without allowing them to copy them (i.e enforce the create shared object permission for all board creation operations)

fields.description:
One current irritation when using "Base swimlanes on Stories" is that you can't easily see the story status when scanning down the taskboard.

Could you display the current status of the parent (story) within the swimlane header, perhaps where/near the 'Move to Done' button?
fields.summary: As a Scrum user I can see a parent issue's status displayed in the swimlane so that I can easily scan the taskboard

fields.description:
Setting a sprint goal is an important way of focussing development and setting a context for the sprint.

Could you add an optional field associated with the sprint for the goal?

Ideally the goal is prominently displayed in the Work and Report views, especially in the "Sprint Report" sub-view.
fields.summary: As a Scrum user I can set a sprint goal so that I am reminded of the sprint's intention throughout
Some Rapid Boards won't load their Version Board
As a plan mode user, I want logging of sprint marker movements

fields.description:
I need the ability to see issues in the Backlog on a per user basis when doing the sprint planning with a Scrum Rapid Board. Having a quick filter where I can type the name of the user is a solution that would work.

The developers (users) on the project are very specialized, and most of the issues are pre-assigned outside of the sprint planning.

This will allow me to address all the issues assigned to a given developer at once, rather than jumping from developer to developer during the planning meeting.
fields.summary: As a manager I would like to filter by user on the Scrum Rapid Board in planning mode
Work mode should periodically check for board data updates

fields.description:
In the Rapid Board Kanban "Work" mode, when a new sub-task is created from a parent please allow GreenHopper to be able to have the option of moving the new subtasks to the same workflow status, as long as the subtask workflow and parent workflows support that status.

Currently, when a new Sub-task is created it will have "Open" status and not the status of its parent.
fields.summary: Rapid Board - Allow new Subtasks to be created under the same status as their parent issues
Allow third parties to add a tab to the GH issue details pane

fields.description: Assignable users permission may contains more than several thousand users. In this case drop-down assignee list is too large. Is it possible to add an option to show it as user picker with auto-complete?
fields.summary: Assignee dropdown is too large when "Assignable users" permission contains several K users.

fields.description:
On the rapid board planning view if user X moves an issue above the Sprint Marker this change is not seen by other users.

The exception to this is if a rank is actually changed (i.e. the issue is ranked below another issue already above the sprint marker and then it is moved above it).
fields.summary: Moving an issue above the sprint marker on rapid board not shared between users

fields.description: See design
fields.summary: Adopt multi sprint view from design

fields.description: See design
fields.summary: Adopt better view of current Sprint in plan mode

fields.description:
COS: 
- Per board
fields.summary: Persistent marker
Reload should not show a huge spinner on work mode

fields.description:
COS:
- Show issue in transitioned to column immediately on drop using the issue's rank whenever possible 
- No change to workflow transition treatment
fields.summary: Optimistic update of issue after transitioning

fields.description:
COS:
- When ranking several cards the result is shown immediately
fields.summary: Optimistic update of rank in work mode
for 5.10.4: Labs is now its own option in Admin

fields.description: In GreenHopper on add version screen the first working day is always Sunday(first screenshot). It is better to add feature to change first working day also in GreenHopper as it works in "main" part of JIRA(second screenshot).
fields.summary: Changing the first working day in GreenHopper pop-up calendar

fields.description:
As implemented, the feature provides "smarter" status selection by examining workflows accessible by the boards.

In the case where a board brings in issue types which are not specific to a project (e.g. the JQL "type = bug" by itself), no attempt will be made to reduce the number of statuses. This is true even if there are _some_ more specific project/issue types in the query.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to see only the potential statuses for the board I am configuring, so that I can more easily map the statuses to columns

fields.description:
At the moment, you can configure the [Task Board Settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Configuring+your+Task+Board+Settings] related to a project. 

It would be a nice feature to have this configuration for different versions or unreleased as well.
fields.summary: Task Board Mapping configuration for versions

fields.description:
New issues should have a marker in the Rapid Board Plan Backlog view to indicate that they have not yet been prioritised. The marker would automatically go away when the issue is moved in the list, or if it's clicked on (if the issue started at the right place).

See also GHS-5368, which suggests that new items appear at the top of the backlog.
fields.summary: Mark newly added un-prioritised issues

fields.description:
When a new JIRA issue is created (particularly Stories and Bugs), it should appear at the top of the Rapid Board Plan Backlog, so that it's more likely to be seen by project planners.

The current design is as follows: 
* If a user adds a new ticket from a view other than the board, then the new ticket is added to the bottom of the backlog. We can confirm the same by creating the ticket and then navigating to the backlog.
* If a user is on the board and creates a new ticket, the new ticket will automatically appear underneath whichever ticket is currently selected.
* If no ticket is selected on the board and a new ticket is added that ticket will appear at the top of the backlog.
fields.summary: New issues to top of backlog

fields.description: thats a lot of boobies (blue footed of course)
fields.summary: Limit the width of board names in the menu dropdown

fields.description:
Pretty sure this extends to any query, it will leave out the last letter in its filter. probably an off by 1 bug?


* Replication steps

Add 3-4 issues with summary

trees
tree
tres
tre

And then type in "tres" and watch how it doesnt filter properly
fields.summary: Instant Filter does not like the letter S

fields.description:
I think this is when adding a remote link. Or it could be after a remote linked issue has been deleted, but i think its the former.

[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2012-06-20 17:56:17,405 http-2990-4 ERROR admin 1076x1609x1 fjaoq7 127.0.0.1 /rest/viewIssue/1/remoteIssueLink/render/10000 [server.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl] Internal server error
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: Asynchronous rendering of remote issue link is not supported
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.issuelink.AbstractIssueLinkRenderer.getFinalContext(AbstractIssueLinkRenderer.java:26)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.issuelink.IssueLinkRendererModuleDescriptorImpl.getFinalHtml(IssueLinkRendererModuleDescriptorImpl.java:81)
fields.summary: UnsupportedOperationException: Asynchronous rendering of remote issue link is not supported
As a GH developer, I'd like the REST interface parameters to be documented in the REST API browser

fields.description: When commenting on an issue from the work view of a sprint on a rapid board, returning to comment editing from comment preview makes an error show up at the top of the page. Happens every time. See screenshot.
fields.summary: Error on rapid board comment preview

fields.description:
For our product, we need to arrange the backlog as following:

Epic, User stories and sub-user stories. 


Currently GH supports only 3 levels of hierarchy - Epic, Story and Tasks. This request is to extend the stories hierarchy for more than 3 levels and table view provding required visualization to view the user-stories and sub-userstories.

Without support for nesting of user stories, it is difficult to use Greenhopper.
fields.summary: Story Hierarchy support in Greenhopper

fields.description:
Given that we already force-rank stories in a Backlog.
And we estimate story points.
We should be able to provide a per-sprint, story point "Velocity" and have GreenHopper automatically plan sprints with tickets by walking down the backlog.

As changes are made to the backlog, these sprints should be re-planned automatically, rather than requiring manual effort to move stories in and out of sprints.

To get an idea how this should work, look at Pivotal Tracker.  While their tool has a long way to go for Enterprise use, they've done a good job of making backlogs and sprints almost manage themselves.  The contents of sprints will change many times to adapt to changing requirements and circumstances, as reflected in a well-maintained backlog.  

With all GH's additional data and configurability, GH could automate sprint planning even better than Pivotal Tracker does, reducing the effort required to just maintaining a solid backlog.

Further, once there has been some progress down a backlog, it is possible for GreenHopper to calculate our velocity empirically, replacing our manual "default" velocity with a more justifiable, data-driven number.

I had to write a Jira plugin to provide us with Velocity, Iteration Views, and Release prediction, but I'm not asking for any of that for now.  It just seems silly to have to manually drag stories around to "create" sprints.  

Sprints will occur in reality, whether we construct them in GreenHopper or not.  Let's make it so those sprints are both planned and tracked automatically, just by having a backlog and burning it down.  :)
fields.summary: Please plan sprints automatically

fields.description: Without being able to see Story Points, Assignee, and Labels, for example, it's difficult to make decisions involving trade-offs between level of effort, or to see when certain needs are not met, which we track using labels.
fields.summary: Please add the ability to customize the card layout on the Rapid Board

fields.description:
As a GreenHopper and Jira user I need to be able to use the Component View in GreenHopper so that I can see issues related to a component, and organise the various components in my project.

This is not possible when using a cascading select custom field in place of the built in components field - as per Atlassian recommendation - as a work around for JRA-846.
fields.summary: Option for Component View / Project Components to be pulled from a cascading select custom field.

fields.description:
The Card Styles screen does not give the ability to control all fields on the new card screen. In our case, the reporter fields must not be changed - ie. the user must not be able to create an issue in another persons name (this can give us problem during securityrevision). There is no clue in the history/activity of the user creating the issue (see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-4618). Because this issue is not resolved, we need to remove the reporter field. That can be done in the normal JIRA screen, but not in the GH create screen. Is there a workaround for this? I can see that I can remove all customfields.
Another note is, why is the view card setup linked to the create card? that is silly. In the card view we want more info than on the create screen.
fields.summary: As project admin, I need to control the New Card fields

fields.description:
Previously our approach to the issue operations shown in the Detail View cog has been to blacklist the ones we don't want, and allow the rest in the original order as they appear.

We don't want operations coming from plugins to interfere with how GreenHopper is used. So we need to change the approach to promote GH/JIRA sanctioned operations first before plugin provided ones.
fields.summary: Only show issue operations that GreenHopper cares about for the Detail View cog, in the order that GH cares about

fields.description:
COS:
- Discuss testing
fields.summary: As a user of the WORK mode, I would like a board that is not rankable to give me a warning when I attempt a rank like action on it and explain what the problem is
Work with the Bonfire team to start defining how they can plug in to GH

fields.description:
GreenHopper, in my opinion, bases too many things on the creation date of records, and the current date, in ways that can't be overridden.

These issues become apparent if you try to create and "run" a demo project.

If I create a project version in the past, tasks that are created after the version start date are excluded from the original estimate. In other words, GH automatically classes them as "new scope". But if I'm creating all of the information after the fact, there's no way to actually know that. Making such critical decisions FOR the user based on a (frankly arbitrary) datum such as a record creation date is far too limiting. (Perhaps the ability to mark the task as either "original" or "added". This gets to the overall issue of scope management in GH, as GHS-1288 for example).

But if I try to create my demo project by creating versions/sprints, tasks and worklogs in the future, the burndown chart won't show this data, apparently because it "hasn't happened yet." Again, IMO, a case of the tool trying to do too much based on whatever the current date happens to be.

I think the tool needs to worry less about enforcing any particular view of how things "should" be, and simply reflect the way they ARE according to the data that's been entered. Of course, where the data are ambiguous, the tool may need to ask for some additional info (like whether a task is "original" or "added").
fields.summary: As a project administrator, I would like to be able to back-date or forward-date any project activity

fields.description: Is it possible to add GreenHopper burndown chart gadgets that tie to the Rapid Board?
fields.summary: Add GreenHopper gadgets to the dashboard that tie to the Rapid Board

fields.description:
We would like to have an option to notify (email) selected JIRA users upon changes of the Rank field of any issue. 

My BA team requires constant monitoring of the backlog (planning board of the unscheduled version) in order to know if there are issues that are not analyzed, which are re-ordered by the PO and possibly became a priority.

Ideally, the result should be an email saying that the Rank of one (or more) issues has been modified. We are not interested in which issues, but rather if any issue has it's Rank value modified.
fields.summary: Notifications on Rank field modification

fields.description:
From Douglas Ferguson

1) It would be nice to have more granularity around the column WIP limit. i.e. We only want 2 features in construction and 9 other tickets (stories, bugs, etc).
If either a) set multiple WIP limits for "groups" of issue types, b) exclude issue types from my wip limit that would really help.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to decide which issues count towards the WIP limit
Plan|Work|Report links should support opening in another tab with middle click (cmd click)

fields.description:
When Creating a rapid board, a user can create as many sprint (one at a time) as the user wants. 

It would be convince for users to have the ability to remove the sprint reports from previous sprints on that created rapid board. 

At the moment, the only way to remove these reports is to remove the rapid board all together.
fields.summary: Have the ability to remove Sprint Reports

fields.description:
When we browsing an issue via default screen, we can use a checkbox "Include Sub-Tasks" for time tracking fields:
!time-tracking-default.png!

On a rapid board, we can open an issue preview, that contains default fields, including time tracking fields. But the same checkbox is missing there.
!time-tracking-rapid-board-view.png|thumbnail!

This is a very useful function, it will be good to see it available on a Rapid Board.
fields.summary: The checkbox "Include sub-tasks" is not available for timetracking fields on an issue preview screen of the Rapid Board
Write a QUnit test for Swimlanes
Write a QUnit test for Chart Table data munging
